revised_title: Jurassic Climate Patterns and Their Implications
tldr: This article examines the climate patterns of the Jurassic period by analyzing the distribution of flora and fauna, as well as the sedimentary and clay mineral records. The study finds that the Jurassic world was relatively equable compared to today, with strong seasonal contrasts in temperature within continental areas and monsoonal effects on the continents. The results of this research are consistent with climate modeling experiments that assume a higher atmospheric content of carbon dioxide during the Jurassic period.
